instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 30 seconds after boot screen scrambles
threads.message: Hi. I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  that after 30 seconds the screen scrambles. At first, my thought was that it was going to be an LCD/cable replacement. I removed the board to look it it over and found that <CHIP>U2600</CHIP> and the area around it was liquid damaged. I have already replaced the damaged components and everything is functioning normal. My question is; can you give me a general idea of how this damaged circuit effected the display image? I am currently tracing through the schematic but a hint would definitely be helpful. Thanks in advance.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 30 seconds after boot screen scrambles
threads.message: does it happen when you tap on the ram slot?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 30 seconds after boot screen scrambles
threads.message: No... Tapping on board and RAM slot didn't make a difference. It would boot up, get to OS for like 30 seconds. Then the screen would go white with full spectrum of color static, then go black. After that happened a couple times that computer would just not POST anymore, just turn on with fans at full throttle. Thats when I pulled the board and notice the damage on <CHIP>U2600</CHIP> and surrounding area. Its no biggie, everything is working now since component replacement. I was just curious to know how problem with <CHIP>U2600</CHIP> would effect LCD in that way. Thanks.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 30 seconds after boot screen scrambles
threads.message:
Thats the clock. If that goes out, then all signals go out of sync, causing all kinds of anomalies.

Its more odd you had a intermittently working clock.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 30 seconds after boot screen scrambles
